alert.note: Alert for Central Brewster County; Chinati Mountains; Chisos Basin (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 30 at 1:42PM CDT until March 31 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A RED FLAG WARNING IS IN EFFECT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 15% OR LESS, 20FT WIND OF 20 MPH OR GREATER, AND HIGH TO VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR MUCH OF SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO AND PORTIONS OF WEST TEXAS... ...A RED FLAG WARNING IS IN EFFECT FOR LATE FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH AFTERNOON FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 15% OR LESS, 20FT WIND OF 20 MPH OR GREATER, AND HIGH TO VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR ALL OF SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO AND MUCH OF WEST TEXAS... ...A RED FLAG WARNING IS IN EFFECT FOR LATE FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH AFTERNOON FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 15% OR LESS, 20FT WIND OF 20 MPH OR GREATER, AND HIGH TO VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR ALL OF SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO AND MUCH OF WEST TEXAS... * AFFECTED AREA...Chinati Mountains, Central Brewster County and Chisos Basin. * TIMING...Late Friday morning through Friday afternoon. * WINDS...West 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 8 percent. * RFTI...5 to 6 or critical. * IMPACTS...Avoid the use of open flames or any activities that may generate sparks. Accidental ignitions will have the potential to grow quickly into dangerous wind-driven wildfires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity and warm temperatures will increase potential for fire growth.

area.areaDesc: Central Brewster County; Chinati Mountains; Chisos Basin
